Package assignment.gui

Class AssignmentTwoGUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • assignment.gui.AssignmentTwoGUI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    public class AssignmentTwoGUI
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
    Contains all the methods which constructs the frame of the gui and sets up its functionality
    See Also:

      • drawRectangles

        public void drawRectangles​(java.lang.String[] line,
                           java.awt.Color penColour,
                           java.awt.Color fillColour)
        The rectangles from the files are scanned then drawn with the pen and fill colour desired
        Parameters:
        line - an array which contains the coordinates of the rectangles which are used to draw them
        penColour - the colour of the pen desired
        fillColour - the colour of the fill desired

      • hex2Rgb

        public static java.awt.Color hex2Rgb​(java.lang.String colorStr)
        Reads the colours that are in hexadecimal format and converts them to RGB colour model
        Parameters:
        colorStr - the colour in hexadecimal format
        Returns:
        the color that has been read

      • loadShapes

        public void loadShapes​(java.lang.String shapeDraw,
                       java.lang.String[] line)
        Scans the contents of the files, draws the shapes and sets the pen and fill colours based on the hexadecimal format that has been read
        Parameters:
        shapeDraw - the string which specifies which shape to draw
        line - an array which contains all the coordinates required to draw each shape
